[et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ fullwidth=”on” admin_label=”Section” _builder_version=”4.16″ transparent_background=”off” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_fullwidth_code admin_label=”Fullwidth Code” _builder_version=”4.16″ global_colors_info=”{}”]

  • CONTACT
    DR WALKER
    TODAY
    Call (07) 55 746 133 for our clinic hours.
[/et_pb_fullwidth_code][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|desktop” admin_label=”Section” _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”||0px|” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”” transparent_background=”off” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,2_3″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” admin_label=”Row” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” custom_padding=”||0px|” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_blurb image=”https://coastgastroenterology.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/about-man.jpg” image_icon_width=”none” admin_label=”Blurb” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” image_max_width=”none” use_circle=”off” use_circle_border=”off” circle_border_color=”#7EBEC5″ circle_color=”#7EBEC5″ global_colors_info=”{}”][/et_pb_blurb][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”2_3″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Text” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]Dr Walker graduated from the University of Queensland in 1999. In 2009, following completion of his core Gastroenterology training, and a 12 month fellowship in interventional endoscopy, Dr Walker obtained his Fellowship with the Royal Australasian College of Physicians (FRACP). Dr Walker commenced work as a Staff Specialist at the Princess Alexandra Hospital before embarking on a further 12 month fellowship in 2010 at the Duke University Medical Center in North Carolina, USA. His 12 months focussed on pancreaticobiliary disease while obtaining further experience in ERCP (Endoscopic Retrograde CholangioPancreatography), Endoscopic Ultrasound and advanced endoscopy. Dr Walker returned to Australia in August 2011 at which time he commenced consulting on the Gold Coast.

Dr Walker’s interests include general gastroenterology, including the management of Coeliac Disease, reflux and irritable bowel syndrome, inflammatory bowel disease and bowel cancer screening. He has a special interest in interventional endoscopy including, endoscopic mucosal resection of large precancerous polyps and dysplastic Barrett’s oesophagus, radiofrequency ablation (HALO), ERCP and endoscopic ultrasound.

Suite 8, Ground Floor, 14 Hill Street, Southport QLD 4215

Dr Walker is actively involved with the Medical Advisory Committee (MAC) at the Gold Coast Private Hospital. He is also actively involved in training junior medical staff, nursing staff and medical students at the Gold Coast University Hospital.

Dr Walker is more than happy to be contacted to discuss patients and/or organise consultation or admission. He offers a full range of endoscopic procedures including open access gastroscopy and colonoscopy.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ admin_label=”Section” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_image=”https://coastgastroenterology.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/about-parallex.jpg” parallax=”on” custom_padding=”100px||100px|” transparent_background=”off” make_fullwidth=”off” use_custom_width=”off” width_unit=”on” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ admin_label=”Row” _builder_version=”4.16″ background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” global_colors_info=”{}”][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”4.16″ custom_padding=”|||” global_colors_info=”{}” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Dr Walker’s areas of special interest include:” _builder_version=”4.16″ text_font_size=”16″ header_text_color=”#00a79d” background_size=”initial” background_position=”top_left” background_repeat=”repeat” background_layout=”dark” custom_margin=”|||20px” use_border_color=”off” border_color=”#ffffff” border_style=”solid” global_colors_info=”{}”]

Dr Walker’s areas of special interest include:

  • General Gastroenterology
  • Pancreatic and Biliary Disease
  • Inflammatory Bowel Disease
  • Open Access Gastroscopy and Colonoscopy
  • Bowel Cancer Screening
  • Therapeutic Endoscopy
  • Endoscopic Mucosal Resection
  • ERCP – Endoscopic Retrograde CholangioPancreatography
  • Endoscopic Ultrasound
  • Radiofrequency Ablation (HALO)

click here.

• CONTACT
    DR WALKER
    TODAY
    Call (07) 55 746 133 for our clinic hours.
Dr Walker graduated from the University of Queensland in 1999. In 2009, following completion of his core Gastroenterology training, and a 12 month fellowship in interventional endoscopy, Dr Walker obtained his Fellowship with the Royal Australasian College of Physicians (FRACP).
